_header: Prefulgent in preciousness O Synope the Queen
_description: ‘The ix ladyes worthy’, a pseudo-Chaucerian poem — nine stanzas rhyme royal

CamTCC599.First Lines:
Prefulgent in precyousnes o Synope the queneOf all femynyne beryng
                    the septre and RegalySubduyng the large contrey of Ermony as hyt was
                    seneMaugre theyr myghtes thow brought theym to aply…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…The proud grekes myghtyly she dyd assayleOuercame and
                    venquysshed theym in batayle
CamTCC599.Note:
Names of ladies, ‘Quene Sinope’, ‘Lady Ipolyte’,
                    etc. in margins beside stanzas for each.
CamTCC599.Attributed Author: by Chaucer (added by later hand, f. 110v)
CamTCC599.Attributed Title:
The ix ladyes worthy (f. 110v); Explicit the baladys of the ix
                    worthyes of ladyes (f. 111)
